text: is a railway station in Tagawa, Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. It is on the Ita Line, operated by the Heisei Chikuhō Railway. Trains arrive roughly every 30 minutes. On 1 April 2009, a local recycling plant, Kanda Shōten, acquired naming rights to the station. Therefore, the station is alternatively known as . ==Platforms== ==External links== *Hoshii Station (Heisei Chikuhō Railway website) ==References== Category:Railway stations in Fukuoka Prefecture Category:Railway stations in Japan opened in 1900 Category:Heisei Chikuhō Railway Ita Line
title: Hoshii Station
